newsitem.title: USA: U.S. OPTIONS FOCUS/Options weigh on CompUSA shares.
newsitem.headline: U.S. OPTIONS FOCUS/Options weigh on CompUSA shares.

text.p: Options trading kept pressure on CompUSA Inc shares Wednesday as investors bought calls and sold the stock as it declined, traders said.
By 1200 CST (1800 GMT), CompUSA was down six at 45-5/8 on consolidated volume of 3.6 million shares. It reached a session low of 45-3/8.
Traders said investors were being aggressive with both the options and the stock.
"A lot of the options is dealing with stock replacement," one trader in Chicago said. "Especially in the front month, which is rather interesting."
The trader said he expected more action in the back months.
"That's one reason the stock is seeing so much pressure here is you've got people coming in and buying the calls and selling the stock back out," he said.
Buying calls and selling stock is equivalent to a synthetic put position.
Volatility in the November calls was trading in the low to mid-60's.
Traders said business was mixed between retail and institutional investors.
The CompUSA November 50 call was the most active, with a total of 1,975 contracts changing hands. Its open interest was roughly 1,810.

On the Chicago Board Options Exchange, the premium on the CompUSA November 50 call was 1-1/4, a 2-1/2-point decline from Tuesday's close. On the American Stock Exchange, the premium was 1-5/16, down 2-3/16.
Other active CompUSA calls included the November 45 and November 55. The most active call outside the November series was the December 50, which traded 278 contracts on the CBOE.
On the put side, the CompUSA November 40 traded a total of 961 contracts, the November 45 traded 674 and the November 50 traded 710.
In other action, a couple of large spreads were seen in shares of Newbridge Networks Corp and Banc One Corp.
On the Pacific Stock Exchange, the Newbridge November 32-1/2 put traded 1,560 contracts and the November 35 put traded 1,670.
Most of the action in both those options was spreads, traders said. Newbridge shares rose 1-3/8 to 31-3/8.
Also on the PSE, the Banc One November 32-1/2 call and the May 40 call each traded 2,800 contracts.
Calls on shares of Bay Networks Inc were active on the CBOE as the stock rallied in heavy trade, traders said.
The shares were up two at 20-1/2 on consolidated volume of 4.8 million shares.
The November 20 call traded more than 2,900 contracts, the December 20 call traded about 1,030 and the November 22-1/2 traded about 975.
--Gregory Crawford, (312) 408-8750
E-mail: derivatives@reuters.com
